CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Recently , it has also been reported that the 2-D conjugated structure of an electron - donating group in conjugated polymers is beneficial to photovoltaic properties. 34 Some copolymers based on 9,10-arene functionalized anthracene have recently been reported , but the absorption ranges of the polymers are limited to the wavelengths shorter than 700 nm and their PCEs are moderate , 4-5 % . 35,36 In this work , we introduced DPP with a strong electron - withdrawing nature to lower the band - gap of TA - based copolymers. In addition , two different DPP derivatives flanked with thiophene ( TDPP ) and furan ( FDPP ) were used to further optimize the energy levels and photovoltaic properties of the copolymer. 27 Both polymers exhibit a low band - gap of 1.65 eV , a deep HOMO energy level of -5.45 eV and a high hole mobility of ca. 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 . Interestingly , a nanoscale BHJ morphology in the blend of the copolymer and PC71BM was well developed without the addition of a processing additive. The solar cell devices fabricated from the copolymers and PC71BM exhibited high PCEs of 7.0% and 5.2% for PTATDPP and PTAFDPP , respectively. Furthermore , the PSC fabricated from the blend of PTATDPP and a non-fullerene electron acceptor ( di-PBI ) showed a promising PCE of 4.23% , demonstrating that PTATDPP has good compatibility with multiple electron acceptors for high efficiency PSCs . The number - average molecular weights ( M n ) of PTATDPP and PTAFDPP were 47.2 and 32.6 kDa with polydispersity indexes ( PDI ) of 2.1 and 2.5 , respectively , as determined by size - exclusion chromatography. PTATDPP and PTAFDPP show the absorption maxima ( λ max ) at 654 nm and 666 nm in solution , respectively , as shown in Fig. 1a , while the two copolymers exhibit nearly the same Scheme 1 Synthesis of monomers for polymerization. absorption onset at 750 nm corresponding to the optical bandgap of 1.65 eV. Both copolymers also exhibit distinct vibronic shoulder peaks at 710 nm which are derived from the coupling of the electronic and vibrational transition. Therefore , these vibronic shoulder peaks at lower energy provide the evidence of strong π-π interactions , indicating that polymer chains are aggregated in the solution state. As compared to the solution state , the absorption onsets in the solid state are extended to 770 nm while the vibronic shoulders become stronger , indicating that both polymer chains exhibit a strong tendency to selfassemble in the solid state , which may induce crystallization. 37 This strong self - assembly of PTATDPP and PTAFDPP arises mainly from highly coplanar nature of the polymer backbone. Therefore , the two copolymers are expected to possess high crystallinity in the solid film state , which is beneficial to efficient charge transport in the device.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. 2-D conjugated structure of an electron - donating group in conjugated polymers
 * Material Name: Conjugated polymers
2. 9,10-arene functionalized anthracene
 * Material Name: Anthracene
3. DPP (with a strong electron - withdrawing nature)
 * Material Name: DPP (Dithiophene)
4. TDPP (flanked with thiophene)
 * Material Name: Thiophene
5. FDPP (flanked with furan)
 * Material Name: Furan
6. PC71BM (processing additive)
 * Material Name: PC71BM (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
7. PSC (polymer solar cell)
 * Material Name: Polymer solar cell
8. Non-fullerene electron acceptor (di-PBI)
 * Material Name: Di-PBI (Bis(2-methyl-8-hydroxyquinolinato)aluminum)

Note that some of these entities may appear multiple times in the paragraph, but I have listed them only once under their respective Material Names.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the Material Names mentioned in the paragraph:

1. DPP (Dithiophene)
2. TDPP (Thiophene)
3. FDPP (Furan)
4. PC71BM (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid Material Names mentioned in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DPP (Dithiophene) |
| TDPP (Thiophene) |
| FDPP (Furan) |
| PC71BM (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene)) |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Recently , it has also been reported that the 2-D conjugated structure of an electron - donating group in conjugated polymers is beneficial to photovoltaic properties. 34 Some copolymers based on 9,10-arene functionalized anthracene have recently been reported , but the absorption ranges of the polymers are limited to the wavelengths shorter than 700 nm and their PCEs are moderate , 4-5 % . 35,36 In this work , we introduced DPP with a strong electron - withdrawing nature to lower the band - gap of TA - based copolymers. In addition , two different DPP derivatives flanked with thiophene ( TDPP ) and furan ( FDPP ) were used to further optimize the energy levels and photovoltaic properties of the copolymer. 27 Both polymers exhibit a low band - gap of 1.65 eV , a deep HOMO energy level of -5.45 eV and a high hole mobility of ca. 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 . Interestingly , a nanoscale BHJ morphology in the blend of the copolymer and PC71BM was well developed without the addition of a processing additive. The solar cell devices fabricated from the copolymers and PC71BM exhibited high PCEs of 7.0% and 5.2% for PTATDPP and PTAFDPP , respectively. Furthermore , the PSC fabricated from the blend of PTATDPP and a non-fullerene electron acceptor ( di-PBI ) showed a promising PCE of 4.23% , demonstrating that PTATDPP has good compatibility with multiple electron acceptors for high efficiency PSCs . The number - average molecular weights ( M n ) of PTATDPP and PTAFDPP were 47.2 and 32.6 kDa with polydispersity indexes ( PDI ) of 2.1 and 2.5 , respectively , as determined by size - exclusion chromatography. PTATDPP and PTAFDPP show the absorption maxima ( λ max ) at 654 nm and 666 nm in solution , respectively , as shown in Fig. 1a , while the two copolymers exhibit nearly the same Scheme 1 Synthesis of monomers for polymerization. absorption onset at 750 nm corresponding to the optical bandgap of 1.65 eV. Both copolymers also exhibit distinct vibronic shoulder peaks at 710 nm which are derived from the coupling of the electronic and vibrational transition. Therefore , these vibronic shoulder peaks at lower energy provide the evidence of strong π-π interactions , indicating that polymer chains are aggregated in the solution state. As compared to the solution state , the absorption onsets in the solid state are extended to 770 nm while the vibronic shoulders become stronger , indicating that both polymer chains exhibit a strong tendency to selfassemble in the solid state , which may induce crystallization. 37 This strong self - assembly of PTATDPP and PTAFDPP arises mainly from highly coplanar nature of the polymer backbone. Therefore , the two copolymers are expected to possess high crystallinity in the solid film state , which is beneficial to efficient charge transport in the device.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. 2-D conjugated structure: This refers to the structure of the conjugated polymers, which has a two-dimensional conjugated structure.
2. 9,10-arene functionalized anthracene: This is the starting material used to synthesize the copolymers.
3. TDPP (thiophene-based DPP): This is one of the two DPP derivatives used in the study, which is based on thiophene.
4. FDPP (furan-based DPP): This is the second DPP derivative used in the study, which is based on furan.
5. PC71BM: This is the electron acceptor used in the solar cell devices fabricated in the study.
6. PTATDPP (polymer containing thiophene and anthracene): This is the copolymer synthesized by introducing DPP with a strong electron-withdrawing nature to lower the band gap of TA-based copolymers.
7. PTAFDPP (polymer containing furan and anthracene): This is the other copolymer synthesized in the study, which is similar to PTATDPP but with a different electron acceptor.
8. BHJ (bulk heterojunction): This is the morphology of the copolymer and PC71BM blend, which forms a bulk heterojunction.
9. HOMO (highest occupied molecular orbital): This refers to the energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbital in the copolymers.
10. LOMO (lowest unoccupied molecular orbital): This refers to the energy level of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital in the copolymers.
11. hole mobility: This refers to the mobility of holes in the copolymers.
12. PCE (power conversion efficiency): This refers to the efficiency of the solar cells fabricated from the copolymers and PC71BM.
13. M n (number-average molecular weight): This refers to the average molecular weight of the copolymers.
14. PDI (polydispersity index): This refers to the degree of polydispersity of the copolymers.
15. λ max (absorption maximum): This refers to the wavelength at which the copolymers absorb light.
16. Scheme (synthesis scheme): This refers to the scheme used to synthesize the monomers for polymerization.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Sure, here are the relevant entities from the text that refer to the property name of a material:

1. "Property Name" - This is the actual term used in the text to refer to the property name of a material.
2. "thiophene" - This is the name of a specific material that is being referred to in the text.
3. "furan" - This is another name of a specific material that is being referred to in the text.

So, the relevant entities from the text that refer to the property name of a material are:

1. "Property Name"
2. "thiophene"
3. "furan"

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities from the text that refer to the property name of a material, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Property Name |
| thiophene |
| furan |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Recently , it has also been reported that the 2-D conjugated structure of an electron - donating group in conjugated polymers is beneficial to photovoltaic properties. 34 Some copolymers based on 9,10-arene functionalized anthracene have recently been reported , but the absorption ranges of the polymers are limited to the wavelengths shorter than 700 nm and their PCEs are moderate , 4-5 % . 35,36 In this work , we introduced DPP with a strong electron - withdrawing nature to lower the band - gap of TA - based copolymers. In addition , two different DPP derivatives flanked with thiophene ( TDPP ) and furan ( FDPP ) were used to further optimize the energy levels and photovoltaic properties of the copolymer. 27 Both polymers exhibit a low band - gap of 1.65 eV , a deep HOMO energy level of -5.45 eV and a high hole mobility of ca. 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 . Interestingly , a nanoscale BHJ morphology in the blend of the copolymer and PC71BM was well developed without the addition of a processing additive. The solar cell devices fabricated from the copolymers and PC71BM exhibited high PCEs of 7.0% and 5.2% for PTATDPP and PTAFDPP , respectively. Furthermore , the PSC fabricated from the blend of PTATDPP and a non-fullerene electron acceptor ( di-PBI ) showed a promising PCE of 4.23% , demonstrating that PTATDPP has good compatibility with multiple electron acceptors for high efficiency PSCs . The number - average molecular weights ( M n ) of PTATDPP and PTAFDPP were 47.2 and 32.6 kDa with polydispersity indexes ( PDI ) of 2.1 and 2.5 , respectively , as determined by size - exclusion chromatography. PTATDPP and PTAFDPP show the absorption maxima ( λ max ) at 654 nm and 666 nm in solution , respectively , as shown in Fig. 1a , while the two copolymers exhibit nearly the same Scheme 1 Synthesis of monomers for polymerization. absorption onset at 750 nm corresponding to the optical bandgap of 1.65 eV. Both copolymers also exhibit distinct vibronic shoulder peaks at 710 nm which are derived from the coupling of the electronic and vibrational transition. Therefore , these vibronic shoulder peaks at lower energy provide the evidence of strong π-π interactions , indicating that polymer chains are aggregated in the solution state. As compared to the solution state , the absorption onsets in the solid state are extended to 770 nm while the vibronic shoulders become stronger , indicating that both polymer chains exhibit a strong tendency to selfassemble in the solid state , which may induce crystallization. 37 This strong self - assembly of PTATDPP and PTAFDPP arises mainly from highly coplanar nature of the polymer backbone. Therefore , the two copolymers are expected to possess high crystallinity in the solid film state , which is beneficial to efficient charge transport in the device.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the values of material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Values of material properties for PTATDPP:
 * Number-average molecular weight (Mn): 47.2 kDa
 * Polydispersity index (PDI): 2.1
 * Absorption maximum (λmax): 654 nm
 * Optical bandgap (Eg): 1.65 eV
 * HOMO energy level: -5.45 eV
 * Hole mobility: ca. 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
2. Values of material properties for PTAFDPP:
 * Number-average molecular weight (Mn): 32.6 kDa
 * Polydispersity index (PDI): 2.5
 * Absorption maximum (λmax): 666 nm
 * Optical bandgap (Eg): 1.65 eV
 * HOMO energy level: -5.45 eV
 * Hole mobility: ca. 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
3. Values of material properties for the blend of PTATDPP and PC71BM:
 * Absorption maximum (λmax): 750 nm
 * Optical bandgap (Eg): 1.65 eV
 * HOMO energy level: -5.45 eV
 * Hole mobility: ca. 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
4. Values of material properties for the PSC fabricated from the blend of PTATDPP and a non-fullerene electron acceptor (di-PBI):
 * Absorption maximum (λmax): 770 nm
 * Optical bandgap (Eg): 1.65 eV
 * HOMO energy level: -5.45 eV
 * Hole mobility: ca. 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1

Note that the values of material properties for PTATDPP and PTAFDPP are similar, as they are derived from the same monomer units. The values for the blend of PTATDPP and PC71BM are also similar to those of PTATDPP, as the PC71BM molecules are added to the PTATDPP polymer matrix. The values for the PSC fabricated from the blend of PTATDPP and di-PBI are not provided in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the relevant entities from the text that refer to the value of material properties:

1. Value of material properties: 47.2 kDa, 32.6 kDa, 1.65 eV, -5.45 eV, ca. 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1

These are the values of the material properties of the two copolymers, PTATDPP and PTAFDPP, as well as the blend of PTATDPP and PC71BM.
